intro: Byttneria lopez-mirandae, commonly known as the Lopez-Miranda byttneria, is a species of flowering plant in the Malvaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Venezuela and Colombia. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and large, palmate leaves that can reach up to 30 centimeters in diameter. It produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, followed by woody, capsule-like fruits. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
